Summary: Large UFO, with 3 bright lights passes over 287-N Highway.
divs: Sighting DetailsMe and my wife were driving home from New Brunswick, and were about 2 miles away from the Easton PA exit on 287-N when my wife remarked on a plane in the sky. I often see commercial airplanes when driving on this route in the evening, and I expected nothing unusual. When I looked in the sky, at about 5 minutes after 11:00pm, I saw (what appeared to me) to be a plane with 2 bright lights, that seemed to be flying relatively low or "close" compared to most of the planes I see flying in the sky. I looked for the tell-tale blinking red and blue lights on the wings that would indicate it as a normal commerical jetliner, but I did not see any. After about 20 seconds, the craft shifted it's orientation, and I realized it had 3 lights, not 2, and it had a faint triangular shape against the sky. At this point I still thought it was possibly a commercial airliner briefly, but I felt confused upon seeing the unusual shape, and size (or altitude) of the aircraft. It seemed either unusually close or unusually large for a craft to be flying overhead, and it moved relatively quickly (in about the span of 40 seconds) west towards the horizon, where it again was only visible from a "side" view, and only 2 lights were visible. It did not move erratically, but simply crossed over from one horizon to the other. At this point, I was taking the Easton PA exit onto route-78, and as I was driving, I lost line-of-sight of the craft. Before I lost line of sight with it, I did notice it was producing a 4th, very faint, blinking red light, that seemed to have a pattern of "blink-blink-stop" about one a second. This last quality of the craft leads me to believe it was probably man-made, although I have no idea what it was. Suggestions by others that it was a "b-2 stealth bomber" or similar military craft seem plausible, but on the other hand, a b-2 bomber would have to be flying awfully low for the lights appear that "large" from our viewpoint, and I have no idea if such military craft have lights arranged on their bottoms in that manner. I still feel I saw something very unusual and I cannot really say for sure what it was I saw.
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in New Brunswick
There were no other sightings in New Brunswick on or around April 29th 2010
